column6: No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

It doesn't really matter which location you go to, it's flicked is definitely number 1. Their name really does say it all. I always get a steak and chicken tacos, the freshness is unmatched. From the masa being made into tortillas to order to the juicy  cuts of  meat of the open flame, piled with fresh toppings. Make  sure to  give your receipt to the guys behind the counter and answer whether you want it  "con todo" or you will be waiting forever.
No comment

Truly the best chain/spot for tacos in the city. I have my local Brooklyn taquerias, but I feel like sometimes their tortillas still don't measure up to LTN1's corn tortillas. It's never dry and the adobada tacos are to die for. Super reliable - even their horchata as well.

Many say that @lostacos1 is the best tacos in the city, and I think I agree with that (fyi not usually a taco person). The tribeca location moves fast and is great for a quick pit stop meal. I think the meat options are significantly better than the cactus one, so I really hope they can come out with more yummy vegan/vegetarian options!
No comment
Great tacos! The off-menu carne de hombre is my absolute favorite, and a must try for first-timers.
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place was packed for the lunch crowd. Standing room only but worth the wait in line. Prices are a bit on the higher side for tacos, but they fill them up and they are extremely flavorful. The only downside I have is that they say their tacos come with guacamole. However, what it actually is is an avocado cream type of sauce. I appreciated the dairy allergy note on the register, but I would have preferred the menu item being called what it actually is rather than simply something that is recognizable by the customers coming in.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Heard New York has terrible tacos. Probably do but this place was as delicious as I was drunk. I actually didn't want to eat too much because I was on a way to a concert but had to stop in and try one. Worth it.
No comment

The line was wrapped out the door in the cold for these tacos!! VERY VERY well worth the wait!! Service is friendly and fast. What drew me in was the fact that the tortillas are hand made daily! The tacos are bursting with flavor! EVERYTHING IS AMAZING!!! Even the hibiscus drink. If you're in the NYC area RUN here!!

This is my favorite taco spot in NYC. All the options are great, chicken, nopal, beef, pork, and try the especial if you want something more like a quesadilla. Be sure to get some of the green and red salsa they keep to the side. This salsa is super spicy! Overall, I would recommend this place to anybody in Tribeca looking for a quick but delicious place to eat.

There was a decent line, but it moves relatively quickly. You order at the counter, and then they make it for you at the next stop along on the counter. The place was packed so challenging to eat there. I snagged a corner of someone else's table, but probably better as a to go option than eating there.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Finally tried the tacos and here is my review:  total price for three tacos is $15.62.  Very pricey for three small tacos.  The chicken one with corn taco is ok, lacks flavor.  The chicken with flour taco is slightly better, but not worth the line.  The pork on flour taco is the only one that is truly  deserving of the hype.  So delicious and flavorful, with small strips of pineapple.  Definitely get the pork flour taco.
No comment

Wanted something quick but delicious after the Hall Des Lumieres. Stopped in here and tried the steak, chicken and pork tacos.  All were delicious. The pork was my favorite. Quick service and yummy food at a good price.

Oh my god. That's all I have to say. The tacos were truly No. 1. Service was quick and to the point, which is great considering they're making their tortillas in house, fresh. I got the carne asada and pollo taco's and a carne asada quesadilla (spoiler alert, not the quesadilla we're all used to but still amazing.) they were so delicious, make sure you get everything on it!!! And add some lime. We came here for a late night eat and we were thoroughly shook at how excellent the food was. Please come here, you won't regret it!
No comment
No comment

Been here on a short business trip. Order and pay at the counter and pass the ticket to the kitchen staff and they will prepare the food. Comfortable dining area. Just standing tables and no seats are available so the turnover is quite quick. I recommend Grilled Chicken Carne Asada Taco Marinated Pork. The meal was the first - Adobada marinated pork, the second - Carne Asada grilled steak.
So simple and delicious! Their salsa and grilled onions are great too! Great snack and lunch spot. I love this type of place with a small menu. Thumbs up!
This joint is among the best I've ever had. FRESH authentic Mexican! Worth the wait in a fast moving line and the pork was slammin.

I've been wanting to try this place for a long time and it finally happened yesterday! I have to say I was a little scared because most of the time when I'm excited to try a place that everybody talks about it ends up disappointing mebut this one wasn't the case!! Food was amazing! Love the fact that they made their own tortilla so it makes it a whole fresh meal! Definitely coming back again or hope to see them near in the future in boston haha!
No comment
Nopales (cactus) on a corn quesadilla. If you haven't tried nopales before, it tastes similar to okra.
You can find better tacos elsewhere for the same price. Only having that weak ass cactus as the veggie option should be a crime!
No comment

This place never disappoints - always consistently delicious and is a quick and satisfying meal. They pack in the meats so usually I find that three of them are pretty filling. I've tried all of the flavors and love them all. The sauces also taste freshly made in house. The corn tortilla is the best!

Best taco spot in all of NYC! It's counter service, and the staff is quick and lively, making the ambiance energetic and fun. There are counters to stand at if you want to eat there, or you can take your items to go. The tacos are worth any line there might be. So delicious, so flavorful, and so addictive. I would eat them everyday if I could!
No comment

The most authentic taco I have found in Lowe Manhattan! So happy to have one within walking distance (even if dangerous)! Team is always friendly and wildly quick. There are several counter areas to stand and enjoy in restraint. Also a park within walking if you want to sit. My favorite part- guacamole isn't extra here ;)
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Stopped by this place on our way to a broadway show for what we thought was the perfect snack before the show in theater district! The line was long but it went so quick. At first the food tasted amazing, the chicken had an indian tikka flair to it and it was the perfect small bite before a show but 6 hours later we have horrible nausea and food poisoning from it :( hoping it was just a bad one time thing but wanted to share the experience

Best tacos I've had in a long time! Coming from California, I've had my share of really good tacos, but this place blows majority of them out of the water. Handmade corn tortillas pressed fresh when ordered and stuffed with filling. I got the carne asana and the adobada. Both were amazing! A little bit on the greasier side, but every bite was so flavorful and good! I was stuffed after eating two tacos, but will be back to try more of the menu.

First time here and already planning the next trip back. These tacos were outstanding. I got both chicken & pork - the pork stole the show for me but the chicken was also good. Toppings are great too, and you can't beat the quality for the price!
No comment

Pleasantly surprised by this taco joint as I hadn't been able to find my go to taco place in New York yet, but this was it! It's slightly pricier but worth it because they load up every taco with plenty of meat and toppings. The service was also delightful & everyone was so friendly. I got the Carne Asada, Al Pastor, & Cactus tacos. Each of them had unique toppings and sauces! Loved all of them so much.

This is always my favorite please to come to eat tacos! If you're a person that does not like flavor this is NOT your place. The steak and chicken are always very well seasoned. Customer services is always A++

This is the closest thing you are going to get to authentic tacos here in NYC. This place is fast and the taco toppings are great. They take your order, give you a receipt, and you can watch live your food being made. The pollo asado and adobada are my favorite
No comment
No comment

Tacos here are around $5 each. I got the carne asada with guacamole. It was delicious. Very satisfying. It's almost twice as much as the tacos from Brooklyn but location location location! Fast service no frills.
Excellent tacos... best I've had in a long time... maybe ever.  Tried the beef, chicken and pork... all super fresh. It is casual... no seats.. all standup table/counter. Very clean.

This place always pleases my taco cravings! Whenever I'm in the city, I always stop by for a taco or more. The staff are professional and quick. The place is very clean and the condiments are always full. I love the consistency as well!

Damn these are consistently the best tacos I've ever had. Everything is incredibly flavorful and fresh and the tortillas and salsas are amazing. All of the tacos are great but my favorite is the Adobada.
No comment

SUCH A GOOD SPOT!! Looking for cheap quick and easy food?? This is the place but be ready to not mess around. They are quick with their ordering and you need to be prepared to answer questions of what you want on your tacos!! So fresh and home made tasting. To die for!

Some of the best tacos I have had in a long time.  It reminded me of a taco stand in San Diego with great flavor and sizable portions.   The only reason I did not give 5 stars is no public restroom but it seems that NYC is that way.

Great tacos and service.  The corn tortillas are a bit thicker than most and hold together great compared to others.  Great to get the tacos to go and head to city park for relaxing lunch.  There was a line but we still got through it quickly and back to the office in 30 minutes
No comment

Tacos were to die for!!! Made fresh right in your face. The salsa was a little spicy but I loved it! Great place to grab a quick and tasty taco on the run. It was our first time there and the girl on cashier was so kind, explained how simple it was. Just put your order in, get a ticket, hand the ticket to a cook and wait. The store was clean, lively, and perfectly set up if you want to stand and eat before continuing on with your day. Can't wait to go back

The chicken taco was one of the best I've had. Getting everything on it is a must. The chicken is juicy and on a freshly made flour tortilla. The staff is so kind and the line is worth it. I wish I could've ate 5 more. Truly a great taco.

Very impressed by the quality of food at Los Tacos No. 1. Was a bit skeptical to try this place, but I am sure glad I did. The meat was succulent and spot on. There is no seating in this restaurant but there are a bunch of table tops to stand at to enjoy your meal. There's also condiments like pico de gallo and turnips and sauces you can get for free at the side corner of the restaurant. Very friendly staff that speak both English and Spanish. Again, very impressed. Will be going back often.
No comment
No comment

Los Tacos is probably the more well known taco places in NY, and for good reason. The meat in the tacos are really juicy and the tortilla are really crispy, which makes for an enjoyable experience. They are extremely quick as well as I only waited about 10 minutes for my tacos. My friend also dropped his tacos and they gave him another two for free. Great service.
No comment
No comment

If you are a hungry vegetarian who likes great food. Come here I am in heaven coming here. The staff are very hard-working and they have the higher standard of Covid care here. Very impressed. I love getting their cactus quesadilla and tacos and if you are around the area run to this place

Overall, really enjoyed Los tacos. The carne asada taco was delicious. Good portion of meat and toppings, very flavorful. The service is very good and even though there was a line (at lunch time), it went by extremely fast. Will definitely visit again!
No comment

column3: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
column6: Let me just say...I am from L.A California where our street tacos are amazing...but let me just say that OMG this place it's AMAZING i had the asada tacos, with everything the meat so tender and juice and the tortillas hand made in front of you...definitely would recommend it
No comment
I got the carne asada taco and the pork taco on corn tortillas con todo and both were amazing! Not really expensive and one of the best lunches I've had recently. Loved!
Great spot super authentic highly recommended if your in the area and love a good taco!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Very affordable and delicious tacos. Service is super quick and this is a great casual and affordable spot
No comment

I went here with some friends for the first time and loved my experience! The line can be long but goes by quickly. The cashier is fast and efficient to get the line moving. From there, you have to give your receipt to the cooks so they can start your order. They will ask corn or flour tortilla and if you want all the toppings. I got Horchata with my order and I would definitely recommend that drink. The tacos themselves were delicious! So much so that we almost got back in line to get more!
No comment
No comment

This was such a great find when roaming the streets of the city. When my friend and I came in, the place was poppin. It was super hot inside with the grill, wearing a mask, and the summer heat of NY but it was 100% worth it. The cooks are working like a machine and get all the food out as fast as can be. And better yet, it was mouth watering good. You really can't beat an authentic taco like the ones at Los Tacos. Would highly recommend for an inexpensive, filling, delicious meal. I am sure the other things on the menu are just as good.

Stopped there last night with my husband and had the Asada Taco Quesadilla and Pork taco. We really enjoyed the food so much. The filling is packed and great flavor. The quality is amazing. Fresh veggies and meat is really good too. The salsa is addicting has balanced flavor. The service is good.
Delicious, inexpensive, quick bite spot.  Chicken and steak are great, marinated pork can get a little messy. Soda is a ripoff.

Los Tacos is always a fantastic spot to grab a quick bite. With a variety of authentic tacos and salsas, los tacos sets itself apart by being really really good at the limited menu they serve. I got the chicken and pork tacos and was blown away by the amount of flavor the pork had. Highly recommend!

Being a girl from San Antonio Texas where tacos are found everywhere and some really good ones at that; I definitely had to make my way to Los Tacos No. 1 to see how authentic the taste and feel of the atmosphere could be to make me feel like I was back home while vacationing in NYC. As you walk in you hear the norteños playing and greeted from those behind the counter. You have different options from asada, chicken, pork and cactus (nopals) for tacos or even quesadillas. The tortillas are freshly made and you can choose flour or corn and of course you have chilé verde (green salsa) or chilé rojo (red salsa) and you definitely can't miss having a nice refreshing aqua fresca to drink on a warm summer day. Los Tacos No. 1 really fulfilled my taco craving and definitely will be making another trip next time I'm in NYC.
No comment
No comment
Best tacos and authentic. Adobada and asada tacos are a must. Fresh handmade tortillas.
No comment
No comment
El nombre es correcto.  Muy bien tacos todo Los Dias.  Me gusto.  Vamanos a Los tacos numero uno ahora!
Tacos we're okay honestly they are not worth it for the price! You are selling cheese tacos not quesadillas for 6.75!!
No crazy lines and worth the wait if anything. These tacos are always a greate bite to eat. Good portion size and nice price!

Very good tacos! Neatly wrapped and the carne asada was delicious indeed. The chicken was a bit burnt however, and they were a bit pricey for the small size. Would come again tho I enjoyed the sauce too

The best tacos ever!!! Like seriously everytime I go there on my lunch break or whenever it tastes even better than the last time lol. The soft tacos or made on the spot & everything is always fresh, sometimes the line is out the door/down the block but it's worth it & they move fast.

I was here yesterday and ordered the Carne Asada Tacos(Steak)!The tacos were really good. They were moist, well seasoned, appropriate portions and the sauce they offered to compliment with the tacos were amazing! I was served by two women. Both ladies offered insight into the brand, their locations! They offered tried to upsell their other products which I appreciated good customer service! The tacos were filling and held me up before an 8 hr shift. I also got a neighborhood discount which was good!

Yes, this place is the real deal. I'm not going to add much that others have already said, but my thesis is this: just go get a bunch of adobada (marinated pork with pineapple) and don't even bother mixing with other tacos. You'll thank me later

Visited NYC and was recommended to not skip eating here. Ok, whoever came up with these delicious ingredients to create these delicious tacos is wrong. It's so wrong it's so right. They are so darn good. Is it the meat, the sauce, I have no idea but these tacos are really good. The chips and guac are just so good. I mean chips and guac. Seems as simple as that, but so so so legit delish. Must eat here.
I loved this place real Athletic Mexican tacos. Great customer service and always super clean!
No comment
Fast service, very tasty food, find environment. Would totally go back. I recommend getting the quesadillas since they have cheese and more meat on them.
No comment

These tacos are awesome! When we first passed this place around noon people were lined up around the block...usually a good sign. When we returned after some shopping (around 3:30) it was much less busy. The tacos were fresh and delicious. I got a Carne asada taco and an adobada taco. So flavorful. Visiting from California we know good Mexican food and Los Tacos was the bomb!

Stopped in for a quick dinner during a work trip. Standing room only at little subway-tiled stalls or mini counters. Guac and chips were excellent and chicken and steak tostadas were delicious. Perfect for a quick bite!

There's no argument, they're definitely full of flavor. However, the portion size is very disappointing. They are like mini tacos and teeny tiny quesadillas. Prices are 25% more than other tacos places. Overated! I will skip if I can. There are so many good tacos places in the city.
No comment
This spot has the best tacos in all of nyc hands down. Soft tortilla. Marinated meat. Super fresh eats. Get the especial you won't regret it and the quesadilla.

Local taco chain in Manhattan and probably the best tacos you can get in NYC. And they're only ~$4/taco, which is a steal!! This place was started by 3 guys from Mexico and California. The food is very authentic, unlike most Mexican restaurants in the area. The meat is cooked really well and the salsas are the perfect compliment. You can't go wrong with anything you order.
No comment

We fell for the long line out the door. We thought that meant something. It meant nothing. This place was kinda trash. Besides the disorganized ordering system, the actual tacos were NOT it. Prices were ok but flavors were LACKING.

This place is set up to help you stick to your schedule, they're fast, and they know what they're doing. And, the tacos are outstanding. Superb. Really, really good. I'm used to the over the top good tacos and Mexican Food in Southern California, and this place delivers that.
No comment
Hands down my favorite taco spot in NYC. Consistently good! I recommend trying the horchata!
No comment
No comment
Amazing tacos. Love the very limited and focused menu. The pork is my favorite but they're all good.

Worst burrito ever. 90% rice and hardly any chicken or beans. I ate it anyway because I didn't have time to argue with anyone as I was on my way to work. Normally this place does good food. Maybe someone just got lazy or just didn't like me.
This place is life changing, has the quality of west coast and Tijuana tacos. Personally my favorite is the adobada taco. But all tacos are delicious. Simple yet amazing.
No comment
No comment

Does Los Tacos No.1 live up to the hype? I think so. Just look at 100s of mouthwatering pictures. The tacos are small but packed to the max. Meatless option being the Nopal (grilled cactus)  $3.75 which I was a little weary of ordering but far exceeded my expectations. I'd say 2-3 tacos per order depending on how hungry you really are. The chips and guacamole $4.75 is a nice add on, gauc is on point. You can also order online for a swift pick up to skip the waiting time.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I stopped in for lunch because I was working right across the street. The service was very quick. All the workers were very professional and moved the line quickly. I got 1 of each tacos minus the cactus one and they were all delicious! So fresh and flavorful and the shout out to the chef who made them! Very good spot for tacos and quick and affordable lunch for anyone in the area. I'll be back if I'm working in the area again
No comment
No comment
No comment

I had the chicken with everything and the asada with everything. The salsa on the side is spicy and good. Had maíz tortillas, tasted freshly made...which they were. Also had the jaimaica, it was perfect. Not to sweet not to sour...just right. A little pricey, but money well spent. 2 tacos satisfied my hunger, where 3 or sometimes 4 is needed. Highly recommend, would go again. the staff speaks Spanish.

This spot does tacos "Al pastor" the right way! You walk in and immediately see the tower of meat and you feel like you are getting authentic street tacos. I had the marinated beef and the pork tacos both delicious and quite filling. Had a Coca Cola in a glass bottle like we all know tastes wayyy better that way, also had one order of Nachos and Guac. This is Mexican street food done right, although prices are per taco, once you taste it, the flavor makes up for the price! The restaurant is set up in a To-Go style I believe is due to Covid restrictions and all the cooks and servers are wearing masks and gloves.
$4.75 + tax  for a mini taco is kind of ridiculous but i must admit they were pretty tasty!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Best Mexican food spot in NYC! No doubt go every time you have a chance. The adobaba is the best ever!

column3: East Fort Lauderdale, Fort Lauderdale, FL
column6: LOVE this place. It's super fun, fast and fantastic! Highly recommend. And I always make a point to eat here when in the city!
No comment
Amazing place , great service , good vibe and tacos are off the hook. As the kids would say in 1980s (turns his ball cap backwards).
super good flavorful food. all the people there are friendly and nice would recommend getting a quesadilla.
No comment
No comment

Was walking bye tonight and was shocked there wasn't that long of a line. When I returned the line was still manageable so ... why not?  I was PLEASANTLY surprised. I had not eaten here in a few years and it did not disappoint. Ordered a few Carne Asada tacos, the meat was tender, the toppings were abundant, and together they created a beautiful symphony of flavor. Will do this again, soon!
Best pork taco I have ever had, fast service, well portioned. Busy, but not overly crowded. Only wish they were open overnight!
food is good, a little expensive but considering it's in new york not a surprise. recommend if you're a paisa looking for some good tacos in new york
No comment

man me and my friend decided to try this place out and I  a feeling it wasnt gonna be good. i had the taco carne Asada. It was ok at first but later on the meat tasted like fish a lil. THEN later on I vomited...... the food was a no go
WE LOVE MARTIN!!! He was super respectful of food allergies and gave me an extra taco because of MY mistake!! Delicious
No comment
No comment

Their Carne Asada and Pollo Asada were soooo good!  The cashier was patient and helpful when we were lost on what to order.  We paid and received the ticket.  When we gave the ticket to the cook, he asked if we wanted Corn or Flour Tortilla.  Also he asked if we want onion, cilantro, guacamole, salsa, or all of then.  They gave us so much meat!  We were full with 1 and a half of taco.  I wish they have a place to sit down as they only have a tall counter table to stand and eat.  We ended up eating at the near by park.  I will definitely come back!
This little taco shop had delicious street tacos. My favorite was the carnitas taco. It was fast service also.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

What a great place !!the best tacos in NEW York by far.. and the condiment station a plus the service is quick and you are able to choose flour or corn tortilla no place to sit but the taco are so good you will go back for more
No comment

Probaly some of the best tacos I've had in my life. Tried the adobada and carne asada on flour tortillas. Meat was perfectly cooked and seasoned, and nicely complemented by the fresh toppings. Portioning of the ingredients on the tortilla is on the generous side, but it wasn't spillover city  Self-serve salsas (very flavorful) and lime wedges was also very appreciated.

Arguably the best tacos in NYC and they're relatively affordable. Most tacos cost under $4, which is a steal in this expensive city. Los Tacos No. 1 has a diverse taco selection, including but not limited to carne asada and cactus. Additionally, they have amazing quesadillas that costs between $4 and $5. I ordered pollo asada tacos, adobada tacos, and pollo asada quesadillas. Each dish was mouth watering delicious. The corn tortillas, meat, chopped cilantro, diced onions, sliced pineapple,and guacamole tasted extremely fresh. Everything is made fresh to order. My favorite item was the chicken quesadillas on flour tortilla. The flour tortilla was perfectly thin and layered with an equally thin coating of cheese. The restaurant and outdoor eating area was clean, allowing for adequate room to social distance. Staff also wore masks and required customers to do the same indoors. Los Tacos No. 1 is added to my list of places to bring visiting friends and family.
No comment

Brand new outpost in the FiDi in Church St. huge open space, standing only. Ok, it is odd to order and get a ticket and then hand that ticket to one of the cooks and wait for them to hand you the plate, but that's how they choose to make it work. Lots of debris and construction material outside the store which sits at the entrance to the train. Still, at lunch time, I am sure the line is out the door. Very small menu, the pork being my favorite over the carne. The Quesadilla seems to be a larger taco, open and easier to eat standing... I'd recommend that to start with, choose either flour or corn.

Real tasty and filling tacos. Love the pork adobada, pollo asado, carne asada in that order. The especial (fried tortilla+cheese+meat) is a great, filling options as well. Topo Chico is ridiculously priced, but goes well with the tacos.

This is my other favorite taco spot. Yooo their tacos are so flavorful. I wish they had a spot in Brooklyn because this is where I prefer my chicken and steak tacos from. Plus their Jamaica Hibiscus as they call it (I call it sorrel) is a nice touch. I'm getting hungry just writing this review. If they had seats, I probably would never leave. I can even appreciate the paper plates that they put the tacos on, covered with a simple piece of foil. It's absolutely tasty. You will absolutely love their tacos.
No comment
No comment

Solid tacos, some of the best in the city and my go-to for chicken tacos. I was so happy when Los Tacos opened a store in our neighborhood. Come for the tacos-if you're a purist then don't get the works (salsa & guacamole at no extra cost) but getting everything is pretty darn good. You get a choice of corn of flour tortilla: get the corn. And ask for lime: you'll get a little bag filled with lime, chilies, and radish at no extra cost. No need to order ahead of time, just walk in with your mask on, order (indicate whether you want it to go or not) they'll call your name when your food's ready for pick up. Wait time is very minimal. Outdoor standing only tables available sans heating lamp.

I'm Mexican and I love tacos, tacos are life for us, but if you are a paisano without papers you are not gonna be able to eat your tacos in this place, forget about it! You are gonna have a pendejo asking you for your papers, maybe if I were gringa they give me a pass. Very disappointed. As a tourist I'm very dissatisfied, I thought NYC was different but it end up to be worst  than a 3 world country, at least in my country nobody ask me for my papers while I eat my tacos. And to be honest this tacos will be consider the worst tacos for a mexican. Si eres mexicano y buscas tacos chingones la neta no, aquí no es donde, puras pinches chingaderas de gringos, tacos fríos,las salsas ni pican, la carne dura y sin sabor, esto NO sabe a México. Nomas les falta ponerle queso , para los gringos agachones esta bien.

As a Mexican that has tried tacos all over the United States, I can confidently say that these tacos by far have been the best tacos I've tried in the US. It even surpassed some of my beloved taco spots back in Mexico. Each taco was filled with an burst of flavors, the salsa's spiciness, with the meats tangy flavor and the pineapples sweetness is just enough to make your mouth drool before you even take your first bite
The BEST tacos EVERRRRR. I would not skip this place. The Adobada Quesadilla with corn tortillas are amazing! This is a must!!
No comment
Cheese shell tacos won me over because of my keto lifestyle.  These tacos are deeelish.  Most definitely a go to place

I wouldn't say my expectation were low, but this place was such a great find. The tacos here were some of the best I've had in a long time. Everything is made to order so you'll always get fresh tacos on a corn or flour tortilla. I love how each bite is actually full of lots of flavors and not just the taste of a tortilla. They also have a nice little salsa bar that helps increase the heat for those who want it.
The food was just as good as the other 2 locations i have tried. The cashier was super slow though, but the tacos were still pretty much the best ones in NY.
No comment

This little spot is worth the try. A few options to choose from. They are quick & efficient. You can place an online order for pick up or go in & order in person. Will definitely visit them again to try their chicken plate, which is what my bf* had.
No comment
No comment
Love this place . I wish they were still accessible through door dash or Uber eats. Everything is good. The tacos are amazing and the guacamole and chips too.
No comment

Get the adobada tacos and you won't regret it. That's literally all you need. I tried the especial asada and wasn't impressed after eating the adobada tacos. It was so good, we had to order a second round of adobada tacos since we knew we were never getting this again until we visit NYC again.

I'm not new to the Los tacos1 family so when I saw this Tribeca location open up I was ecstatic. The flavors are consistent across locations. Good flavors, quick and efficient service. Had 3 chicken tacos this visit con todo and enjoyed veery bite. The horrachata is always a win for me. Very refreshing.
No comment

Don't walk - run - to this taco joint. The adobada is the best taco I've ever had in my life, no hyperbole. This spot is 100% authentic Mexican street taco cart. The tortillas are homemade: both corn and flour. There's only like three toppings and four choices and that's all you'll ever need in life. Seriously had an out of body experience eating here.

Ya ever wake up and read a Yelp review and say to yourself.."I gotta have that today!" ? Yeah well that was me. After thinking to myself..is there something I can get here that I just cant get elsewhere? Yup....fried quesadillas!  I had the chicken and it was worth every penny of the roughly $8 plus tip. When i get good food i feel generous and they are generous with quality and flavor. Grateful to have these nice people here with authenticity.

Best tacos, I use to go to the one in Chelsea market but this location is super convenient because it's next to my job. I have tried all 4 types of tacos they have and my favorite has to be the pork because of sweetness from the pineapple and spicy sauce they put on it. The staff is super friendly and service is good. It can be a bit confusing if you are new to this place. You place your order and than give your ticket to the cook. It can be a bit anxious since a lot of people are waiting for their food to be called but there hasn't been a time when they gave your order to someone else. Definitely worth coming back. I recommend coming early to beat the line.
The  service was good. It was pretty fast despite the line. The tacos were good but definitely not the greatest! This place is overhyped. Had better tacos with better prices in other places.
No comment
This is my favorite taco spot in the city - well worth the wait every time. Try the pork taco- you won't regret it!
No comment
No comment

OMG. So first I'm from South Texas, and we know our tacos. This place was spot on. The ingredients are fresh, and full of flavor. We ordered the adobada quesadilla and taco & asada quesadilla and taco, con todo. So good!! Salsas are also very good. Must try when in NYC

My favorite taco joint and I have been able to return because they removed the family bundle off the menu! Can't afford it anymore! Bring back the family pack! I haven't had them in more than a year!!
Great place and great tacos taste just like I was visiting Mexico again I enjoy every meal I eat there.
Pretty fun spot. Food is good. Very authentic. Chips are less than beautiful - but they suffice. Great for a quick lunch.
Went inside for a quick bite of some tacos and man these some good tacos. I got steak and chicken tacos! Good place to go for a quick bite
Best tacos that I've eaten so far in the city but I could definitely suggest you to try the beef taco and shrimp taco which I think were the best. Their guac and chips were also good.
The line was out the door when we went but it was so worth it , Best Tacos I've ever had !! They had homemade tortillas , great salsa , Can't wait to go back !
No comment

The vibe of this place is so great and the food is even better. Tacos are around 4.50 each so if you get two for a meal it's around $10. The tacos are filling and so delicious the crane asada and pork adobado are my favorite. You have to take your ticket after paying and give it to a cook. It's fun and they're polite and fast. Horchata was delicious as well. Definitely a must try if you love Mexican food!!
Chicken tacos are AMAZING! The guac really compliments the chicken. The pork tacos were alright, nothing special. But chicken tacos are a must get!

My Yelp feed is showing that Los Tacos No. 1 only has 4.5 stars. That's absurd. These are the best tacos I have ever consumed. If you are going to get tacos in the City, come here and order the adobado. You will not be disappointed. Nice staff and a great drink selection as well!

I was at the office and it was close for lunch and had good reviews so I went.  I got two chicken tacos on corn loaded and man were they delicious! They had just the right spices and were pretty darned authentic.  The place was crowded but I found a spot to enjoy them by the window. I also had their horchata which was awesome.  I'll be back!

I came across this place as one of the cheapest & great spots to eat in NYC & all I can say is they are right. The pork taco was absolutely the best in my opinion & the chicken quesdadilla was juicy. Steak taco was too chewy for me but the flavors were all there. I like how you have unlimited access to condiments on the side.  yummy!

Great spot for a quick, filling, delicious lunch. The adobada tacos hit all the notes-- sweet, savory, and packing a little punch. Highly recommend the corn tortillas and getting the tacos con todo for the full experience!

Pretty good spot. Tacos are tasty and the staff seemed cool. The tacos are on the small side and the after you order it's a little disorganized when they ask you what you want and if it's to go or stay. The person who takes your order should enter it according to how you want it to avoid all the disorder and crowd at the food counter.
My favorite lunch spot in TriBeCa. Go there around 1130 to beat the rush. Everything is absolutely tasty and fresh.
No comment

It was my second time going to Los tacos during my 3-day visit in New York. I loved their tacos so much that I had to revisit. This was the only restaurant I revisited during my NYC trip! Their carne asada tacos are SO good.
These tacos were amazing! Highly recommend the adobo tacos. The line may be long but it moves pretty fast.
Run they have breakfast burritos now!!! Ham and potatoes and egg or chorizo and egg. Mon-Fri 8am-11am
Best taco "chain" in nyc. Everything is great. Tortillas are made fresh to order! Check it out

I had steak, cactus, and pork tacos - all on flour tacos. They were excellent. Lots of optional toppings to choose from. Not the best I had in my life or anything, but excellent for New York City. The Horchata was also great.

The best quesadillas you will ever have!! My personal favorite is Steak Especial, a fried steak quesadilla. They have a secret menu item called Queso Taco, a taco on a fried cheese surface. It's really good, but too oily for some people. The regular tacos are awesome, but you MUST get the especial, I usually order a taco and an especial when I go.

This place had some super good tacos, the only thing that leaves it from being a 5 is the price. It wasn't the best tacos I've had but they were probably the most expensive. I would eat there again but it's not a place I would consider an amazing value.

I just tried this place for the first time and I'm not impressed at all. Granted, the meat(s) are juicy and well seasoned (especially the steak) but it just feels (and tastes) like it was all thrown together with no kind of effort. Their tacos are also very spicy, which can be a negative to some. Everything is fresh, so I guess that's a good thing, but that's about all I can say. While this place and their food didn't do much for ME, I'm sure others will enjoy.
No comment

I loveeeeeeeeee this restaurant! I've been to their Time Square location and I'm so happy that they opened one in TriBeCa near my job. Since I'm on keto I've been seeing on social media that they do a cheese crusted tacos with your preferred filling and all the works which includes cilantro, onions, guacamole and salsa. I decided on getting the chicken and let me tell you something; I'm glad I ordered this. The cheese was delicious and the juices of the chicken were overflowing. The best I've ever had. The prices on the tacos could be steep but you pay for what you get and you're in the city. Definitely come and check them out and if you're not by tribeca check their other locations.

I came here on the first day they opened so the line was really long but it was worth the wait. The employees were friendly and the food was amazing!  The tacos were very fresh and the prices are reasonable. I will definitely be back.
No comment

Man what can I say, these tacos are good as hell. Like literally. I don't know what they be doing back there but these hoes come out extra juicy every time. This place is a must go. 10/10 would recommend. Tip: the horchata and the other fruity drink be bussin too, y'all should get on that.
No comment
Came here for lunch with my coworkers. We all enjoyed our meals a lot! we each got a few tacos to try. Definitely a great spot if you work in the area!

Probably the best Tacos I've had in Manhattan. The make every taco to order so you know it's fresh. They also marinate and cook other meat in front of you as well. The tortillas are hand made on the spot and taste very good. The have both corn and flour tortillas to you to choose from. The meat is juicy and very flavorful. Finally the portions are good and you will probably be full if you get 3 tacos with chips on the side. Great price for great food, would highly recommend you check it out
What can be better than a taco shop few blocks away from your apartment? Everything is fresh and smells amazing! Definitely will be coming here often!

We have been ordering their "make your own taco bar" every Friday night for three weeks now.  First off, this location opened not long before the pandemic, so you have to give them credit for toughing it out.  Secondly and most importantly this is the most authentically Mexican taco we have had in NYC... in years.  Fresh, delicious, light, and served family style.  You can choose from Carne Asada, Pollo Asado, Adobada, Nopal (all are great).  The family meal comes with Onion, Cilantro, Salsa, Guacamole, Limes and Radishes, Chips, Guac and a Trio of Salsas with 4 warm tortillas per person.  I would highly recommend the make your own taco family order (for 2-10 people) as a decently priced, fun, and tasty dinner.
No comment
